intro: Romulea linaresii var. corsica, commonly known as Corsican glory-of-the-snow, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers in early spring. The plant is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often growing in mountainous areas. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental plants. This variety is noted for its hardiness and ability to thrive in mild, temperate climates.
